trans-unit.source: Azure AD Graph API Versioning
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Graph API Versioning

trans-unit.source: This topic summarizes the version differences for Graph API entities and operations.
trans-unit.target: This topic summarizes the version differences for Graph API entities and operations.

trans-unit.source: You must specify the version of an operation that you want to use by including the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> query string parameter in your request.
trans-unit.target: You must specify the version of an operation that you want to use by including the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> query string parameter in your request.

trans-unit.source: Requests without an <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter will be rejected and return a <legacyBold>(400) Bad Request response</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Requests without an <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter will be rejected and return a <legacyBold>(400) Bad Request response</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: If your service calls an older version of an operation, you can choose to continue calling the older version, or modify your code to call a newer version.
trans-unit.target: If your service calls an older version of an operation, you can choose to continue calling the older version, or modify your code to call a newer version.

trans-unit.source: Any differences in functionality between versions are outlined in the documentation for the entity upon which you are performing the call.
trans-unit.target: Any differences in functionality between versions are outlined in the documentation for the entity upon which you are performing the call.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with Graph API version 1.5, the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter value for General Availability (GA) versions is specified as a numeric value.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with Graph API version 1.5, the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter value for General Availability (GA) versions is specified as a numeric value.

trans-unit.source: The following URI shows how to query the top-level resources for tenant domain contoso.com using Graph API version 1.5: <codeInline>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com?api-version=1.5</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The following URI shows how to query the top-level resources for tenant domain contoso.com using Graph API version 1.5: <codeInline>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com?api-version=1.5</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: For previous versions of Graph API, the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter value is specified as a date string in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD.
trans-unit.target: For previous versions of Graph API, the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter value is specified as a date string in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD.

trans-unit.source: The following URL shows how to query the top-level resources of the same tenant using the 2013-11-08 version of the Graph API: <codeInline>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com?api-version=2013-11-08</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The following URL shows how to query the top-level resources of the same tenant using the 2013-11-08 version of the Graph API: <codeInline>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com?api-version=2013-11-08</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: For preview features, the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter value is specified using the string “beta” as follows: <codeInline>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com?api-version=beta</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For preview features, the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter value is specified using the string “beta” as follows: <codeInline>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com?api-version=beta</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: API contract, versioning and breaking changes
trans-unit.target: API contract, versioning and breaking changes

trans-unit.source: We will increment the API version number for any breaking changes to the API, in order to protect client applications.
trans-unit.target: We will increment the API version number for any breaking changes to the API, in order to protect client applications.

trans-unit.source: We may choose to increment the API version for non-breaking changes too (for example, if we add some significantly large new capabilities).
trans-unit.target: We may choose to increment the API version for non-breaking changes too (for example, if we add some significantly large new capabilities).

trans-unit.source: So, what constitutes a breaking change?
trans-unit.target: So, what constitutes a breaking change?

trans-unit.source: Removing or renaming APIs or API parameters
trans-unit.target: Removing or renaming APIs or API parameters

trans-unit.source: Changes in behavior for an existing API
trans-unit.target: Changes in behavior for an existing API

trans-unit.source: Changes in Error Codes & Fault Contracts
trans-unit.target: Changes in Error Codes & Fault Contracts

trans-unit.source: Anything that would violate the Principal of Least Astonishment
trans-unit.target: Anything that would violate the Principal of Least Astonishment

trans-unit.source: The addition of new JSON fields to responses does not constitute a breaking change.
trans-unit.target: The addition of new JSON fields to responses does not constitute a breaking change.

trans-unit.source: For developers who generate their own client proxies (like WCF clients) our guidance is your client applications should be prepared to receive properties and derived types not previously defined by the Graph API service.
trans-unit.target: For developers who generate their own client proxies (like WCF clients) our guidance is your client applications should be prepared to receive properties and derived types not previously defined by the Graph API service.

trans-unit.source: Although Graph API is not yet OData V4 compliant at the time of this writing, it still follows the guidance described in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Versioning section in the OData V4 spec</linkText><linkUri>http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.0/errata02/os/complete/part1-protocol/odata-v4.0-errata02-os-part1-protocol-complete.html#_Toc406398209</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Although Graph API is not yet OData V4 compliant at the time of this writing, it still follows the guidance described in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Versioning section in the OData V4 spec</linkText><linkUri>http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.0/errata02/os/complete/part1-protocol/odata-v4.0-errata02-os-part1-protocol-complete.html#_Toc406398209</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: When we increment the major version of the API (for example from 1.5 to 2.0), we are signaling that all support for existing clients using previous 1.x or earlier versions will be deprecated and no longer supported after 12 months.
trans-unit.target: When we increment the major version of the API (for example from 1.5 to 2.0), we are signaling that all support for existing clients using previous 1.x or earlier versions will be deprecated and no longer supported after 12 months.

trans-unit.source: Please see the <externalLink><linkText>Microsoft Online Services Support Lifecycle Policy</linkText><linkUri>https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/gp/lifecycle#gp/osslpolicy</linkUri></externalLink> for more details.
trans-unit.target: Please see the <externalLink><linkText>Microsoft Online Services Support Lifecycle Policy</linkText><linkUri>https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/gp/lifecycle#gp/osslpolicy</linkUri></externalLink> for more details.

trans-unit.source: Supported Versions
trans-unit.target: Supported Versions

trans-unit.source: The following versions have been released for the Graph API.
trans-unit.target: The following versions have been released for the Graph API.

trans-unit.source: Version beta
trans-unit.target: Version beta

trans-unit.source: The Graph API features currently in Preview can be found in either the <link xlink:href="a383e9f2-cee7-48b0-9013-50d06a2ab9e8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Preview Features</link> section of the Graph API documentation, or on the <externalLink><linkText>Graph Team Blog</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/aadgraphteam/archive/2015/03/15/full-text-search-capabilities-in-azure-ad-graph-api-preview.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, and require the “api-version=beta” query string parameter.
trans-unit.target: The Graph API features currently in Preview can be found in either the <link xlink:href="a383e9f2-cee7-48b0-9013-50d06a2ab9e8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Preview Features</link> section of the Graph API documentation, or on the <externalLink><linkText>Graph Team Blog</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/aadgraphteam/archive/2015/03/15/full-text-search-capabilities-in-azure-ad-graph-api-preview.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, and require the “api-version=beta” query string parameter.

trans-unit.source: When the Graph API team believes that a preview feature is ready for GA, we will add that feature to the latest GA version (or if it constitutes a breaking change this would result in an incremented new version number).
trans-unit.target: When the Graph API team believes that a preview feature is ready for GA, we will add that feature to the latest GA version (or if it constitutes a breaking change this would result in an incremented new version number).

trans-unit.source: We make no guarantees that a preview feature will be promoted to GA.
trans-unit.target: We make no guarantees that a preview feature will be promoted to GA.

trans-unit.source: For the beta version, we will try to avoid any breaking changes as much as possible, but we will not guarantee it.
trans-unit.target: For the beta version, we will try to avoid any breaking changes as much as possible, but we will not guarantee it.

trans-unit.source: Client applications using the beta version should expect breaking changes from time to time.
trans-unit.target: Client applications using the beta version should expect breaking changes from time to time.

trans-unit.source: Please see <externalLink><linkText>Supplemental Terms of Use for Microsoft Azure Previews</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Please see <externalLink><linkText>Supplemental Terms of Use for Microsoft Azure Previews</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Version 1.6
trans-unit.target: Version 1.6

trans-unit.source: This section lists the changes for Graph API version 1.6.
trans-unit.target: This section lists the changes for Graph API version 1.6.

trans-unit.source: Graph API version 1.6 introduces the following feature changes:
trans-unit.target: Graph API version 1.6 introduces the following feature changes:

trans-unit.source: At release, the client-facing interface (entities, complex types, functions, and actions) has not changed; however, changes will occur as features are added or updated.
trans-unit.target: At release, the client-facing interface (entities, complex types, functions, and actions) has not changed; however, changes will occur as features are added or updated.

trans-unit.source: Graph Client versions 2.1.x require Graph API version 1.6; Graph Client versions 2.0.x require Graph API 1.5.
trans-unit.target: Graph Client versions 2.1.x require Graph API version 1.6; Graph Client versions 2.0.x require Graph API 1.5.

trans-unit.source: Version 1.5
trans-unit.target: Version 1.5

trans-unit.source: This section lists the changes for Graph API version 1.5.
trans-unit.target: This section lists the changes for Graph API version 1.5.

trans-unit.source: Graph API version 1.5 introduces the following feature changes:
trans-unit.target: Graph API version 1.5 introduces the following feature changes:

trans-unit.source: The schema namespace of Graph API has changed from <system>Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory</system> to <system>Microsoft.DirectoryServices</system>.
trans-unit.target: The schema namespace of Graph API has changed from <system>Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory</system> to <system>Microsoft.DirectoryServices</system>.

trans-unit.source: This affects all entities and complex types exposed by Graph API.
trans-unit.target: This affects all entities and complex types exposed by Graph API.

trans-unit.source: Support for directory schema extensions has been added.
trans-unit.target: Support for directory schema extensions has been added.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to add properties that are required by your application to directory objects.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to add properties that are required by your application to directory objects.

trans-unit.source: The following entities support schema extensions: user, group, tenant detail, device, application, and service principal.
trans-unit.target: The following entities support schema extensions: user, group, tenant detail, device, application, and service principal.

trans-unit.source: To support directory schema extensions: the <system>ExtensionProperty</system> entity has been added, the <system>extensionProperties</system> navigation property has been added to the <system>Application</system> entity, and a new function, <system>getAvailableExtensionProperties</system>, has been added to return the registered extension properties of supported directory objects.
trans-unit.target: To support directory schema extensions: the <system>ExtensionProperty</system> entity has been added, the <system>extensionProperties</system> navigation property has been added to the <system>Application</system> entity, and a new function, <system>getAvailableExtensionProperties</system>, has been added to return the registered extension properties of supported directory objects.

trans-unit.source: For more information about extending the directory schema, see <link xlink:href="ffe9bc40-cdc2-4ae2-a560-2a5d401809c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph API Directory Schema Extensions</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about extending the directory schema, see <link xlink:href="ffe9bc40-cdc2-4ae2-a560-2a5d401809c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph API Directory Schema Extensions</link>.

trans-unit.source: The way in which permissions are represented has changed and is more tightly aligned with OAuth 2.0 concepts as well as with the way permissions are represented in other Azure components.
trans-unit.target: The way in which permissions are represented has changed and is more tightly aligned with OAuth 2.0 concepts as well as with the way permissions are represented in other Azure components.

trans-unit.source: The <system>Permission</system> entity has been removed and has been replaced with the <system>OAuth2PermissionGrant</system> entity.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Permission</system> entity has been removed and has been replaced with the <system>OAuth2PermissionGrant</system> entity.

trans-unit.source: This entity represents delegated OAuth 2.0 permissions scopes that arrive in an OAuth 2.0 access token scope claim.
trans-unit.target: This entity represents delegated OAuth 2.0 permissions scopes that arrive in an OAuth 2.0 access token scope claim.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the new <system>AppRoleAssignment</system> entity represents application roles that can be assigned to users, groups and service principals.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the new <system>AppRoleAssignment</system> entity represents application roles that can be assigned to users, groups and service principals.

trans-unit.source: Two related complex types have also been added: <system>AppRole</system> and <system>OAuth2Permission</system>.
trans-unit.target: Two related complex types have also been added: <system>AppRole</system> and <system>OAuth2Permission</system>.

trans-unit.source: This change has precipitated renaming some properties and adding others in the following entities: <system>Application</system>, <system>Group</system>, <system>ServicePrincipal</system>, and <system>User</system>.
trans-unit.target: This change has precipitated renaming some properties and adding others in the following entities: <system>Application</system>, <system>Group</system>, <system>ServicePrincipal</system>, and <system>User</system>.

trans-unit.source: The <system>Role</system> entity is renamed to <system>DirectoryRole</system>.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Role</system> entity is renamed to <system>DirectoryRole</system>.

trans-unit.source: The <system>RoleTemplate</system> entity is renamed to <system>DirectoryRoleTemplate</system>.
trans-unit.target: The <system>RoleTemplate</system> entity is renamed to <system>DirectoryRoleTemplate</system>.

trans-unit.source: The following tables list the entities, complex types, and functions that have been added, changed, or removed for this release.
trans-unit.target: The following tables list the entities, complex types, and functions that have been added, changed, or removed for this release.

trans-unit.source: Entity Changes
trans-unit.target: Entity Changes

trans-unit.source: Entity
trans-unit.target: Entity

trans-unit.source: Change Description
trans-unit.target: Change Description

trans-unit.source: Updated the <embeddedLabel>appId</embeddedLabel> property from Edm.Guid to Edm.String.
trans-unit.target: Updated the <embeddedLabel>appId</embeddedLabel> property from Edm.Guid to Edm.String.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoles</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the collection of application roles that an application may declare.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoles</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the collection of application roles that an application may declare.

trans-unit.source: These roles can be assigned to users, groups or service principals.
trans-unit.target: These roles can be assigned to users, groups or service principals.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>groupMembershipClaims</embeddedLabel> property, which is a bitmask that configures the "groups" claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that your application expects.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>groupMembershipClaims</embeddedLabel> property, which is a bitmask that configures the "groups" claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that your application expects.

trans-unit.source: The bitmask values are: 0: None, 1: Security groups and Azure AD roles, 2: Reserved, and 4: Reserved.
trans-unit.target: The bitmask values are: 0: None, 1: Security groups and Azure AD roles, 2: Reserved, and 4: Reserved.

trans-unit.source: Setting the bitmask to 7 will get all of the security groups, distribution groups, and Azure AD roles that the signed-in user is a member of.
trans-unit.target: Setting the bitmask to 7 will get all of the security groups, distribution groups, and Azure AD roles that the signed-in user is a member of.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>knownClientApplications</embeddedLabel> property, which contains a list of client applications that are tied to this resource application.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>knownClientApplications</embeddedLabel> property, which contains a list of client applications that are tied to this resource application.

trans-unit.source: Consent to any of the known client applications will result in implicit consent to the resource application through a combined consent dialog (showing the OAuth permission scopes required by the client and the resource).
trans-unit.target: Consent to any of the known client applications will result in implicit consent to the resource application through a combined consent dialog (showing the OAuth permission scopes required by the client and the resource).

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2AllowImplicitFlow</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies whether this web application can request OAuth2.0 implicit flow tokens.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2AllowImplicitFlow</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies whether this web application can request OAuth2.0 implicit flow tokens.

trans-unit.source: The default is <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The default is <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2AllowUrlPathMatching</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies whether, as part of OAuth 2.0 token requests, Azure AD will allow path matching of the redirect URI against the application's <system>replyUrls</system>.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2AllowUrlPathMatching</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies whether, as part of OAuth 2.0 token requests, Azure AD will allow path matching of the redirect URI against the application's <system>replyUrls</system>.

trans-unit.source: The default is <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The default is <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2Permissions</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the collection of OAuth 2.0 permission scopes that the web API (resource) application exposes to client applications.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2Permissions</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the collection of OAuth 2.0 permission scopes that the web API (resource) application exposes to client applications.

trans-unit.source: These permission scopes may be granted to client applications during consent.
trans-unit.target: These permission scopes may be granted to client applications during consent.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2RequiredPostResponse</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies whether, as part of OAuth 2.0 token requests, Azure AD will allow POST requests, as opposed to GET requests.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2RequiredPostResponse</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies whether, as part of OAuth 2.0 token requests, Azure AD will allow POST requests, as opposed to GET requests.

trans-unit.source: Default is <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>, which specifies that only GET requests will be allowed.
trans-unit.target: Default is <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>, which specifies that only GET requests will be allowed.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>requiredResourceAccess</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies resources that this application requires access to and the set of OAuth permission scopes and application roles that it needs under each of those resources.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>requiredResourceAccess</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies resources that this application requires access to and the set of OAuth permission scopes and application roles that it needs under each of those resources.

trans-unit.source: This pre-configuration of required resource access drives the end-user consent experience.
trans-unit.target: This pre-configuration of required resource access drives the end-user consent experience.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>extensionProperties</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which contains the extension properties associated with the application.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>extensionProperties</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which contains the extension properties associated with the application.

trans-unit.source: New entity that is used to record when a user or group is assigned to an application.
trans-unit.target: New entity that is used to record when a user or group is assigned to an application.

trans-unit.source: In this case it will result in an application tile showing up on the user's app access panel.
trans-unit.target: In this case it will result in an application tile showing up on the user's app access panel.

trans-unit.source: This entity may also be used to grant another application (modeled as a service principal) access to a resource application in a particular role.
trans-unit.target: This entity may also be used to grant another application (modeled as a service principal) access to a resource application in a particular role.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>sipProxyAddress</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies the voice over IP (VOIP) session initiation protocol (SIP) address for the contact.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>sipProxyAddress</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies the voice over IP (VOIP) session initiation protocol (SIP) address for the contact.

trans-unit.source: Added the <system>deletionTimestamp</system> property, which indicates the time at which a directory object was deleted.
trans-unit.target: Added the <system>deletionTimestamp</system> property, which indicates the time at which a directory object was deleted.

trans-unit.source: It only applies to those directory objects which can be restored.
trans-unit.target: It only applies to those directory objects which can be restored.

trans-unit.source: Currently this is only supported for <system>Application</system>.
trans-unit.target: Currently this is only supported for <system>Application</system>.

trans-unit.source: Renamed from <system>Role</system>.
trans-unit.target: Renamed from <system>Role</system>.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>roleTemplateId</embeddedLabel> property
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>roleTemplateId</embeddedLabel> property

trans-unit.source: Renamed from <system>RoleTemplate</system>.
trans-unit.target: Renamed from <system>RoleTemplate</system>.

trans-unit.source: New entity that allows an application to define and use a set of additional properties that can be added to directory objects (users, groups, tenant details, devices, applications, and service principals) without the application requiring an external data store.
trans-unit.target: New entity that allows an application to define and use a set of additional properties that can be added to directory objects (users, groups, tenant details, devices, applications, and service principals) without the application requiring an external data store.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>onPremisesSecurityIdentifier</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the on-premises security identifier (SID) for the group that was synchronized from on-premises to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>onPremisesSecurityIdentifier</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the on-premises security identifier (SID) for the group that was synchronized from on-premises to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoleAssignments</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of applications (service principals) that this group is assigned to.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoleAssignments</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of applications (service principals) that this group is assigned to.

trans-unit.source: New entity that specifies an OAuth2.0 delegated permission scope.
trans-unit.target: New entity that specifies an OAuth2.0 delegated permission scope.

trans-unit.source: The specified OAuth delegated permission scope may be requested by client applications (through the <system>requiredResourceAccess</system> collection) calling this resource application.
trans-unit.target: The specified OAuth delegated permission scope may be requested by client applications (through the <system>requiredResourceAccess</system> collection) calling this resource application.

trans-unit.source: Replaces the Permission entity which is removed from this version.
trans-unit.target: Replaces the Permission entity which is removed from this version.

trans-unit.source: Renamed to <link xlink:href="190a3538-80be-4ce4-8250-9bd6f26b7136" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OAuth2PermissionGrant</link>..
trans-unit.target: Renamed to <link xlink:href="190a3538-80be-4ce4-8250-9bd6f26b7136" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OAuth2PermissionGrant</link>..

trans-unit.source: Renamed to <link xlink:href="a866c097-7c4c-4328-9eda-6fa81a62b12a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DirectoryRole</link>.
trans-unit.target: Renamed to <link xlink:href="a866c097-7c4c-4328-9eda-6fa81a62b12a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DirectoryRole</link>.

trans-unit.source: Renamed to <link xlink:href="958bcda9-207a-4ae3-962f-88fb1cf1fc7d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DirectoryRoleTemplate</link>.
trans-unit.target: Renamed to <link xlink:href="958bcda9-207a-4ae3-962f-88fb1cf1fc7d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DirectoryRoleTemplate</link>.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>appDisplayName</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies the display name exposed by the associated application.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>appDisplayName</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies the display name exposed by the associated application.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoleAssignmentRequired</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies whether an <system>AppRoleAssignment</system> to a user or group is required before Azure AD will issue a user or access token to the application.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoleAssignmentRequired</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies whether an <system>AppRoleAssignment</system> to a user or group is required before Azure AD will issue a user or access token to the application.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoles</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the application roles exposed by the associated application.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoles</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the application roles exposed by the associated application.

trans-unit.source: For more information see the <system>appRoles</system> property definition on the <system>Application</system> entity.
trans-unit.target: For more information see the <system>appRoles</system> property definition on the <system>Application</system> entity.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2Permissions</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the OAuth 2.0 permissions exposed by the associated application.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2Permissions</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the OAuth 2.0 permissions exposed by the associated application.

trans-unit.source: For more information see the <system>oauth2Permisions</system> property definition on the <system>Application</system> entity.
trans-unit.target: For more information see the <system>oauth2Permisions</system> property definition on the <system>Application</system> entity.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>preferredTokenSigningKeyThumbprint</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>preferredTokenSigningKeyThumbprint</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: Reserved for internal use only.
trans-unit.target: Reserved for internal use only.

trans-unit.source: Do not write or otherwise rely on this property.
trans-unit.target: Do not write or otherwise rely on this property.

trans-unit.source: May be removed in future versions.
trans-unit.target: May be removed in future versions.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoleAssignedTo</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of applications that the service principal is assigned to.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoleAssignedTo</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of applications that the service principal is assigned to.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoleAssignments</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of principals (users, groups, and service principals) that are assigned to this service principal.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoleAssignments</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of principals (users, groups, and service principals) that are assigned to this service principal.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2PermissionGrants</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of user impersonation grants associated with this service principal.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2PermissionGrants</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of user impersonation grants associated with this service principal.

trans-unit.source: Removed the <embeddedLabel>permissions</embeddedLabel> navigation property
trans-unit.target: Removed the <embeddedLabel>permissions</embeddedLabel> navigation property

trans-unit.source: Removed the <system>tenantType</system> property.
trans-unit.target: Removed the <system>tenantType</system> property.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>onPremisesSecurityIdentifier</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the on-premises security identifier (SID) for the user that was synchronized from on-premises to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>onPremisesSecurityIdentifier</embeddedLabel> property, which contains the on-premises security identifier (SID) for the user that was synchronized from on-premises to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>sipProxyAddress</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies the voice over IP (VOIP) session initiation protocol (SIP) address for the user.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>sipProxyAddress</embeddedLabel> property, which specifies the voice over IP (VOIP) session initiation protocol (SIP) address for the user.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoleAssignments</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of applications (service principals) that this user is assigned to.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>appRoleAssignments</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of applications (service principals) that this user is assigned to.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2PermissionGrants</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of OAuth 2.0 user impersonation grants associated with this user.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>oauth2PermissionGrants</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of OAuth 2.0 user impersonation grants associated with this user.

trans-unit.source: Removed the <embeddedLabel>permissions</embeddedLabel> navigation property.
trans-unit.target: Removed the <embeddedLabel>permissions</embeddedLabel> navigation property.

trans-unit.source: Complex Type Changes
trans-unit.target: Complex Type Changes

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Change Description
trans-unit.target: Change Description

trans-unit.source: New type that specifies application roles that may be requested by client applications calling this application, or that may be used to assign the application to users or groups in one of the specified application roles.
trans-unit.target: New type that specifies application roles that may be requested by client applications calling this application, or that may be used to assign the application to users or groups in one of the specified application roles.

trans-unit.source: New type that represents an OAuth 2.0 permission scope.
trans-unit.target: New type that represents an OAuth 2.0 permission scope.

trans-unit.source: The specified OAuth 2.0 permission scope may be requested by client applications (through the <system>requiredResourceAccess</system> collection) calling this resource application.
trans-unit.target: The specified OAuth 2.0 permission scope may be requested by client applications (through the <system>requiredResourceAccess</system> collection) calling this resource application.

trans-unit.source: New type that specifies the set of OAuth 2.0 permission scopes and app roles under the specified resource that this application requires access to.
trans-unit.target: New type that specifies the set of OAuth 2.0 permission scopes and app roles under the specified resource that this application requires access to.

trans-unit.source: New type that represents a permission that this application requires.
trans-unit.target: New type that represents a permission that this application requires.

trans-unit.source: Action and Function Changes
trans-unit.target: Action and Function Changes

trans-unit.source: Function
trans-unit.target: Function

trans-unit.source: Change Description
trans-unit.target: Change Description

trans-unit.source: New function that returns the full list of extension properties that have been registered in a directory.
trans-unit.target: New function that returns the full list of extension properties that have been registered in a directory.

trans-unit.source: Extension properties can be registered for the following entities: <system>User</system>, <system>Group</system>, <system>Device</system>, <system>TenantDetail</system>, <system>Application</system>, and <system>ServicePrincipal</system>.
trans-unit.target: Extension properties can be registered for the following entities: <system>User</system>, <system>Group</system>, <system>Device</system>, <system>TenantDetail</system>, <system>Application</system>, and <system>ServicePrincipal</system>.

trans-unit.source: New function that returns all of the <system>Group</system> and <system>DirectoryRole</system> objects that a user, contact, group, or service principal is transitively a member of.
trans-unit.target: New function that returns all of the <system>Group</system> and <system>DirectoryRole</system> objects that a user, contact, group, or service principal is transitively a member of.

trans-unit.source: New function that returns the directory objects specified in a list of object IDs.
trans-unit.target: New function that returns the directory objects specified in a list of object IDs.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify which resource collections (users, groups, etc.)
trans-unit.target: You can also specify which resource collections (users, groups, etc.)

trans-unit.source: should be searched by specifying the optional <parameterReference>types</parameterReference> parameter.
trans-unit.target: should be searched by specifying the optional <parameterReference>types</parameterReference> parameter.

trans-unit.source: New service action that allows a deleted application to be restored.
trans-unit.target: New service action that allows a deleted application to be restored.

trans-unit.source: Version 2013-11-08
trans-unit.target: Version 2013-11-08

trans-unit.source: This section lists the changes for Graph API version 2013-11-08.
trans-unit.target: This section lists the changes for Graph API version 2013-11-08.

trans-unit.source: The following tables list the entities, complex types, and functions that have been added, changed, or removed for this release.
trans-unit.target: The following tables list the entities, complex types, and functions that have been added, changed, or removed for this release.

trans-unit.target: Entity Changes

trans-unit.target: Entity

trans-unit.target: Change Description

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>owners</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of directory objects that are owners of the application.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>owners</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of directory objects that are owners of the application.

trans-unit.source: The owners are a set of non-admin users who are allowed to modify this object.

trans-unit.target: Inherited from <system>DirectoryObject</system>.

trans-unit.target: The owners are a set of non-admin users who are allowed to modify this object.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>ownedObjects</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of directory objects that are owned by the current object.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>ownedObjects</embeddedLabel> navigation property, which points to the set of directory objects that are owned by the current object.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>immutableId</embeddedLabel> property, which associates an on-premises Active Directory user account to its Azure AD user object.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>immutableId</embeddedLabel> property, which associates an on-premises Active Directory user account to its Azure AD user object.

trans-unit.source: This property must be specified when creating a new user account in the Graph if you are using a federated domain for the user’s <embeddedLabel>userPrincipalName</embeddedLabel> (UPN) property.
trans-unit.target: This property must be specified when creating a new user account in the Graph if you are using a federated domain for the user’s <embeddedLabel>userPrincipalName</embeddedLabel> (UPN) property.

trans-unit.source: Added the <embeddedLabel>userType</embeddedLabel> property, which is a string value that can be used to classify user types in your directory, such as “Member” and “Guest”.
trans-unit.target: Added the <embeddedLabel>userType</embeddedLabel> property, which is a string value that can be used to classify user types in your directory, such as “Member” and “Guest”.
